Package decoupled.verification

Class Verifier

java.lang.Object
decoupled.verification.Verifier
public class Verifier extends Object
The Verifier class provides a verify function that will return if a program is correct or not on a given input space. Variables such as extraAssertions, correctTerms, additionalTerms, globalConstraints, and repairConstraint can modify this input space. These variables are set by internal functions that implement the divide and conquer algorithms. The end user can simply use the verify function like it is a standard CEGIS loop in their Synthesizer class.
Author:
Thomas Welsch

  • Constructor Details

    • Verifier

      public Verifier(String functionName, String[] verVarNames, String[] extraAssertions, String functionDeclarationString, String assertionString, String logic, String[] correctTerms)
      Constructor for Verifier. Does standard constructor stuff, also initializes rand, enables parallel Z3 calls globally, and builds tempVarNames.
      Parameters:
      functionName - The name of the target function we are synthesizing e.g. max3.
      verVarNames - Variable names as they appear in the formal specification.
      extraAssertions - Predicates that were obtained through splitting or BSPR.
      functionDeclarationString - The target function's declaration.
      assertionString - A String that is the concatenation of all the constraints from the formal specification on the target function.
      logic - The SMT Lib logic e.g. LIA.
      correctTerms - Terms (i.e. on LIA, Int programs) that during a run of Split and Conquer were perfect on a restricted input space.

  • Method Details

    • verify

      public VerificationResult verify(String program) throws VerificationException
      Verifies if a program is correct for the input space determined by the Verifier class's state. If it is, status on the VerificationResult is set as UNSAT. If it is incorrect and a counterexample can be found, the status is set as SAT and a CounterExample on which that program is incorrect is also set. If an error is encountered or it is unknown if it is correct, status is set as UNKNOWN and, if an Excepction was encountered, this is set as well.
      Parameters:
      program - The program to be verified.
      Returns:
      VerificationResult - Contains status and, if encountered, an exception.
      Throws:
      VerificationException

    • verify

      public VerificationResult verify(String program, VerificationCallParameters vcp) throws VerificationException
      Verifies if a program is correct for the input space determined by the Verifier class's state. If it is, status on the VerificationResult is set as UNSAT. If it is incorrect and a counterexample can be found, the status is set as SAT and a CounterExample on which that program is incorrect is also set. If an error is encountered or it is unknown if it is correct, status is set as UNKNOWN and, if an Excepction was encountered, this is set as well.
      Parameters:
      program - The program to be verified.
      vcp - A class that has optional parameters including number of threads, timeout, previously found CounterExamples and a Z3 context.
      Returns:
      VerificationResult - Contains status and, if encountered, an exception.
      Throws:
      VerificationException

    • verifyPartials

      public boolean verifyPartials(String[] partials, String[] coveredAssertions)
      Checks if partials cover an input space such that at least one partial in partials is correct for any given input. If coveredAssertions is null, the input space is all inputs, otherwise it is the input space covered by coveredAssertions i.e. where each assertion in coveredAssertions is true.
      Parameters:
      partials - A set of programs to be verified.
      coveredAssertions - Predicates obtained by splitting that restrict the input space.
      Returns:
      True if partials are verified to cover the input space, false otherwise

    • isProgramCorrect

      public boolean isProgramCorrect(String program, String[] extraAssertions) throws VerificationException
      A wrapper of the verify method that sets the extraAssertions and then runs a verify call and returns true if the status is UNSAT. Otherwise returns false, including if exceptions are encountered.
      Parameters:
      program - The program to be verified.
      extraAssertions - Predicates that can restrict the input space.
      Returns:
      true if the program was verified as correct, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      VerificationException
